sentences.en: A tart temper never mellows with age.
sentences.cn: 凶悍的性情,绝不会因为年龄增长而变得温和.

sentences.en: He was nasty about my appearance. If I dressed up he'd say I looked like a tart.
sentences.cn: 他对我的外表要求很苛刻，我要是打扮打扮，他就会说我像荡妇。

sentences.en: I don't like a tart apple.
I had rhubarb tart with a lot of cream.
sentences.cn: 我吃了添加了许多奶油的大黄小馅饼.

sentences.en: If any cracks have appeared in the tart case, fill these in with raw pastry.
sentences.cn: 如果饼皮开裂，就用生的油酥面团填平。

sentences.en: She's a fine decent tart, he said with appreciation.
sentences.cn: “她是个规矩的好妞儿, ”他赞赏地说.

sentences.en: The blackberries were a bit too tart on their own, so we stewed them gently with some apples.
sentences.cn: 光黑莓味道有点儿冲，所以我们将它和几个苹果一起用小火炖了炖。

sentences.en: The fruit has a tart and astringent flavour.
The tart flavour of the cranberries adds piquancy.
The tea goes with this tangy lemon tart perfectly.
sentences.cn: 这种茶配上这种香味扑鼻的柠檬塔非常完美。

sentences.en: The words were more tart than she had intended.
sentences.cn: 话听起来太刻薄，她本没想这么刻薄的。

sentences.en: These apples are a bit tart.
This tree runs to quite tart fruit.
sentences.cn: 这棵树结的果子都很酸.

trans.tran_cn: 酸的，辛辣的，尖刻的，严厉的
trans.tran_en: food that is tart has a sharp sour taste

trans.tran_cn: 果馅饼，轻佻的女人，妓女，小妞
trans.tran_en: a  pie  without a top on it, containing something sweet
